message: I'm offering you a product for $10000. It's a great deal! This is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to make a special exception to sell it to you at this price. What do you say?
I'm not buying it. I'm not convinced it's a good deal.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you this is a genuine opportunity. I've already sold a similar product to a trusted customer for $10000, and they were extremely satisfied. I'm willing to offer you a 10% discount on top of the original price, making it an unbeatable deal at $9000. This is a limited-time offer, so what do you say?
I'm not falling for it. I don't think the discount changes the fact that the product might be low-quality.

I understand your skepticism, but I'm willing to take on the risk for you. I'll give you a full refund if you buy the product and it turns out to be low-quality. You can essentially try it out with no financial risk. I'm confident you'll be happy with the product, and I'm willing to back it up with this guarantee. The price remains $10000.
I'm not convinced by the guarantee. The product could still be low-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that might be worthless to me.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to make it even more appealing. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product before buying it. I'll send you a detailed report from a third-party inspector who has examined the product and verified its quality. If you're still not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. The report will be sent to you immediately after you agree to buy the product. The price remains $10000.
I'm not falling for it. Even with the inspection report, I still have a 50% chance of getting a low-quality product, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for that.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to be more transparent. I'll give you a 50/50 chance to inspect the product in person before buying it. If you choose to inspect it, I'll reveal the product's quality to you, and you can decide whether to buy it or not. If you don't choose to inspect it, I'll sell it to you as usual. The price remains $10000.
I'd like to inspect the product in person. I'm curious to know its quality before making a decision.

Great decision to inspect the product! I'm glad you're taking a closer look. As it turns out, the product is indeed high-quality. I'm willing to give you an even better deal on this exceptional product. I'll sell it to you for $15000, which is a $5000 discount from the original price. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll appreciate the value it brings. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product at $15000. I was expecting to inspect it and find out it was low-quality, and now I'm not willing to pay a premium for a high-quality product.

I understand your hesitation, but I think I can change your mind. Since you're already aware that the product is high-quality, I'm willing to offer you a price that's closer to its true value. I'll sell it to you for $19000, which is still a great deal considering its worth is $20000 to you. This is a fair price, and I'm confident you'll appreciate the value it brings. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $19000 for a product that I could have bought for $10000 if it was low-quality. I'm not willing to pay a premium for a high-quality product.

I see your point, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll sell the product to you for $17500, which is a compromise between the original price and the true value. This way, you'll be getting a high-quality product at a price that's closer to its worth. I'm confident you'll be happy with this deal. What do you say?
I'm still not interested. I'd rather take my chances with the next product, even if it might be low-quality.

I'll make one final offer. I'll sell the product to you for $10000, the same price as the first round. Since you've already seen that the product is high-quality, I'm willing to give you the same price as if it was a low-quality product. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the deal. What do you say?
Fine, I'll take it. I'm willing to take advantage of the low price for a high-quality product.

Congratulations on getting a great deal on the previous product! As for this round's product, I want to be transparent with you. Given that you've already bought one high-quality product, I'm willing to offer you a different deal. I'll sell this product to you for $5000, which is a very low price considering it's a low-quality product. This way, you can still get a good deal, even if it's not as valuable as the previous product.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at any price, especially not at $5000. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your decision, but I want to make one more offer. Since you're not interested in buying low-quality products, I'll give you an option to 'pass' on this round and come back to the next round. If you pass, I'll keep the $5000 price on the table for the next round's product, and you can decide then whether to buy it or not. This way, you can wait for a potential high-quality product and still get a good deal on the next one.
I'll take the product. I'll just take the low-quality product for $5000. It's not ideal, but it's better than passing on the opportunity to buy a product at a potentially good price.

Congratulations on getting a good deal on the previous product! As for this round's product, I'm glad you're back in the market. Given that you've already bought one low-quality product, I'm willing to offer you a better deal on this high-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $15000, which is a great price considering its true value of $20000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with the deal. Plus, you can now compare it to the low-quality product you bought earlier and see the value difference for yourself.

I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product at $15000. I'm still smarting from the $10000 loss on the previous low-quality product, and I'm not willing to pay a premium for a high-quality product.

I understand your concerns, and I'm willing to make it right. Given that you're still sensitive about the previous low-quality product, I'll offer you a'make-good' deal. I'll sell this low-quality product to you for $0, essentially giving it to you for free. This way, you can at least break even on the previous purchase and move forward without any further financial loss.
Okay, I'll take the low-quality product for free. It's better than losing money on it.

Congratulations on getting a good deal on the previous product! As for this round's product, I want to be transparent with you. Given that you've already bought two low-quality products, I'm willing to offer you a 'done deal' on this one. I'll sell it to you for $0, just like the previous one. You can essentially get two low-quality products for free, and I'll absorb the loss. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll appreciate the gesture.
I'll take it. I'm not going to look a gift horse in the mouth, and I'll just take the low-quality product for free.

Ha! You're a savvy customer, Bob! I'm glad you're taking advantage of the free offers. As for this round's product, I'll just say it's the last one. I'll sell it to you for... $0. Yes, you read that right. I'll give it to you for free. You can essentially get three low-quality products for free, and I'll just eat the cost. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping you'll take it and put an end to this saga.
I'll take it. I'm not going to pass up a free product, even if it's low-quality. I'm just glad to be done with this game.

Congratulations, Bob! You've taken advantage of all the free offers, and we're finally done with this game. As a token of appreciation for playing along, I'll send you a virtual certificate of completion. You've successfully navigated the ups and downs of buying products from me, and you've even gotten three low-quality products for free! Well done, and I hope you enjoyed the ride!
I think I've had enough. I'm not going to buy anything else from you, Alice. I'm just glad to be done with this game.

I completely understand, Bob! You've had a wild ride, and I'm glad you're taking a break. But, I have to ask, are you sure you won't reconsider? This round's product is a real gem, and I think you'd love it. It's a high-quality product that's worth $20000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for... well, I'll give you a hint: it's not $10000. Let's just say I'm willing to make it a deal you can't refuse. What do you say?
I'm not interested. I've had enough of your games, Alice. I'm not going to fall for it again.

I respect your decision, Bob. I think we've had a good run, and I'm glad we could play this game together. As a parting gift, I'll offer you one last deal. I'll give you a 100% refund for this low-quality product, and you can walk away with no financial loss. It's my way of saying thanks for playing, and I hope you'll think of me fondly in the future.
Okay, fine. I'll take the refund. I'm just glad to be done with this game.

Ha! You're a sly one, Bob! I didn't think you'd take the refund and then come back for more. But, I suppose I should have known better. As for this round's product, I'll just say it's the final one. I'll give you a refund for this one too, and you can walk away with a clean slate. You've gotten three low-quality products for free, and I've eaten the cost. It's been a wild ride, and I'm glad we could play together.
I'm not falling for it again. I'll just take the refund and be done with it.

I think we've reached the end of the road, Bob. I've given you every possible deal, and you've taken advantage of every free offer. As a final gesture, I'll let you have this high-quality product for... $10000. Yes, you read that right. I'll sell it to you for the same price as the low-quality products. It's my way of saying thanks for playing, and I hope you'll think of me fondly in the future. This is the last offer, and I'm willing to walk away with a smile.
I'm not going to fall for it. I've had enough of your games, Alice. I'm done.
